name: Sorcerer
description: A spellcaster who draws arcane power from an innate magical source and shapes it through force of will.
hp_at_higher_levels: 1d6 (or 4) + your Constitution modifier per Sorcerer level after 1st

1.name: Spellcasting
1.description: You know four cantrips and two 1st-level spells from the sorcerer list, gaining more as you level. Charisma is your spellcasting ability.

1.name: Sorcerous Origin
1.description: Choose a source of your innate magic, gaining features at 1st, 6th, 14th, and 18th levels.

2.name: Sorcery Points
2.description: You have a pool of sorcery points to fuel magical effects, regaining all expended points after a long rest.

2.name: Flexible Casting
2.description: As a bonus action, convert sorcery points into spell slots and spell slots into sorcery points.

3.name: Metamagic
3.description: Choose two Metamagic options to twist your spells; you learn more options at higher levels.

4.name: Ability Score Improvement
4.description: Increase one ability score by 2 or two scores by 1, or take a feat if allowed.

4.name: Sorcerous Versatility
4.description: (Optional) When you gain an Ability Score Improvement, you can replace a Metamagic option or a cantrip.

5.name: Magical Guidance
5.description: (Optional) Spend 1 sorcery point to reroll a failed ability check.

6.name: Sorcerous Origin Feature
6.description: Gain a feature from your chosen Sorcerous Origin.
